content.question:
At a manufacturing company, the percent of defective items produced on the assembly line is 2%. The company is testing a new assembly line designed to reduce the percent of defective parts. The null and alternative hypotheses of the test are described as follows.
<math alttext="H sub 0, the percent of defective parts is at least 2 percent. H sub a, the percent of defective parts is less than 2 percent." display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mtext>The percent of defective parts is at least 2%.</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mtext>The percent of defective parts is less than 2%.</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

Which of the following describes a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error that could result from the test?

choices.label: The test does not provide convincing evidence that the percent is less than 2%, but the actual percent is 3%.
The test does not provide convincing evidence that the percent is less than 2%, but the actual percent is 2%.
The test does not provide convincing evidence that the percent is less than 2%, but the actual percent is 1%.
The test provides convincing evidence that the percent is less than 2%, but the actual percent is 2%.
The test provides convincing evidence that the percent is less than 2%, but the actual percent is 1%.

content.answer: The test does not provide convincing evidence that the percent is less than 2%, but the actual percent is 1%.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
